label: Playful
tips: Keep jaw mobile and smile lightly to brighten tone
Use crisp consonants and short phrases for bounce
Add gentle body sway to keep the groove alive

label: Hopeful
tips: Lengthen out-breaths to smooth phrases
Lift soft palate for a rounder, resonant color
Let the eyes lift slightly to suggest openness

label: Sad
tips: Sing a touch under mezzo-forte to keep vulnerability
Loosen jaw and keep vibrato gentle at phrase ends
Allow small breaths between ideas—no rush

label: Angry
tips: Ground through feet and keep ribs buoyant for supported power
Use clean, punchy consonants—avoid throat squeeze
Channel intensity forward; release shoulders and neck

label: Romantic
tips: Legato lines with steady airflow and gentle onset
Soften lips on vowels for a plush color
Invite micro-smiles through the eyes, not just the mouth

label: Contemplative
tips: Use slightly slower pace and clear diction
Keep dynamics in the mezzo-piano to mezzo range
Let small silences land between phrases

label: Epic / Anthemic
tips: Stack posture tall and expand ribs for sustained power
Aim vowels forward and high for ring
Build dynamics across sections; save peak for the climax

label: Groovy
tips: Subdivision in the body (knees/hips) to keep pocket
Lean into consonants on backbeat placements
Keep jaw relaxed; think 'speechy' vowels for clarity

label: Spiritual
tips: Deep, quiet inhales; long phrases on warm vowels
Ease the larynx with yawny space for depth
Eyes soft; invite resonance rather than force

label: Nostalgic
tips: Use a gentle onset and slight rubato for storytelling
Color vowels slightly darker for a vintage feel
Let breaths coincide with lyric images

label: Empowering
tips: Anchor breath low; think 'wide back' on inhales
Clear diction on key affirming words
Lift posture and visualize sending sound to the back row

label: Lullaby
tips: Soft dynamics with ultra-steady airflow
Rounded vowels and minimal consonant bite
Slight rocking motion to steady tempo and breath
